Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text: Changes to this Policy\nThis Policy may change from time to time. If there are any material changes to this Policy, Mobilewalla will notify you through the Site or Website Services, by email or as otherwise required by applicable law. You understand and agree that you will be deemed to have accepted the updated Policy if you use the Site and Website Services after the updated Policy is posted to this website. If at any point you do not agree to any portion of the Policy then in effect, you must immediately stop using the Site and Website Services.
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text: When visiting the Site, Mobilewalla may capture information that you voluntarily provide, and information that is automatically collected by your device.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Our Site is not directed to children under 16 years of age, and we do not knowingly collect personal information on such users.
Label: Others

Text:
The Personal Information that You Provide to Mobilewalla Voluntarily
When you contact Mobilewalla, by filling out a form on the Site, subscribing for email updates, requesting a trial of our services, participating in a survey or contacting our customer support team or when Mobilewalla contacts you regarding any of the above, we may receive and process any personal information that you provide such as your name and job title, your company’s name and type, phone number, country, and email address.

If you submit personal information in a comment on a blog post or on any applicable social media websites, the personal information that you submit can be read, collected or used by others and could be used to send you unsolicited messages or otherwise contact you. Mobilewalla is not responsible for the personal information that you choose to submit in these blogs or social media websites. This information is considered “public” and not subject to this Policy.

Mobilewalla may use the information you provide via the Site for its business’ purposes, such as responding to your inquiries or support requests, for marketing, recruiting and hiring, and to contact you in the course of providing you with any of the Website Services and/or the Mobilewalla newsletter or blog. Mobilewalla retains the information collected via the Site for so long as you use the Website Services or until you choose to unsubscribe from the Mobilewalla mailing list, or until Mobilewalla deletes your personal information pursuant to a written request from you (subject to certain exceptions prescribed by law).
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: The Personal Information that Mobilewalla Collects Automatically\nWe may collect certain information automatically through our Site and Website Services, such as cookie identifiers, mobile carrier, mobile advertising identifiers, MAC address, IMEI, unique identifiers, browser type and language, hardware type, operating system, IP address, location, Internet service provider, and other actions taken through the use of the Website Services such as preferences. Mobilewalla may also collect information about your activity on the Site and Website Services (e.g., the duration of sessions, pages or content viewed, pages visited before and after using the Site or Website Services, and the date and time visited).
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Research and Development. We may use personal information to create non-identifiable information that we may use alone or in the aggregate with information obtained from other sources, in order to help us to optimally deliver our Site and Website Services or develop new products. We may perform research via surveys and engage third party service providers to conduct such surveys on our behalf. All survey responses are voluntary, and the information collected will be used for research and reporting purposes to help us better serve individuals by learning more about their needs and the quality of the products and services we provide. The survey responses may be utilized to determine the effectiveness of our Site and Website Services, various types of communications, advertising campaigns, and/or promotional activities. If an individual participates in a survey, the information given will be used along with that of other study participants. We may use de-identified individual and aggregated data for research and analysis purposes.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed
Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed
Categories of Personal Information Sold
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Other Uses. Mobilewalla will use information you provide to enforce Mobilewalla’s terms, policies and legal agreements, to comply with court orders and warrants, and assist law enforcement agencies, to collect debts, to detect and prevent malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity, to prevent and prosecute any misappropriation, infringements, identity thefts and any other misuse of the Website Services, and to take any action in any legal dispute and proceeding.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text:
Sharing Personal Information with Others
Vendors and Service Providers. We may share any information we receive with vendors and service providers. The types of service providers (processors) to whom we entrust personal information include service providers for: IT and related services; the provision of information and services you have requested; payment processing; customer service activities; and the provision of the Site and Website Services. We have executed appropriate contracts with our service providers that prohibit them from using or sharing personal information except as necessary to perform the contracted services on our behalf or to comply with applicable legal requirements.

Business Partners. We may share personal information with our business partners, and affiliates for our and our affiliates’ internal business purposes or to provide you with a product or service that you have requested. Mobilewalla may also provide personal information to business partners with whom we may jointly offer products or services, or whose products or services we believe may be of interest to you. In such cases, our business partner’s name will appear, along with ours. Mobilewalla requires our affiliates and business partners to agree in writing to maintain the confidentiality and security of personal information they maintain on our behalf and not to use it for any purpose other than the purpose for which we provided them.

Privacy Shield. With respect to onward transfers to agents under Privacy Shield, Privacy Shield requires that Mobilewalla remain liable should its agents process personal information in a manner inconsistent with the Privacy Shield Principles.

Marketing – Interest-Based Advertising and Third Party Marketing. Through our Site and Website Services, we may allow third party advertising partners to set tracking tools and Technologies to collect information regarding your activities and your device (e.g., your IP address, mobile identifiers, page(s) visited, location, time of day). We may also combine and share such information and other information (such as demographic information and past purchase history) with third party advertising partners. These advertising partners may use this information (and similar information collected from other websites) for purposes of delivering targeted advertisements to you when you visit third party websites within their networks. This practice is commonly referred to as “interest-based advertising” or “online behavioral advertising. We may allow access to other data collected by the Site and Website Services to share information that may be useful, relevant, valuable or otherwise of interest to you. If you prefer not to share your personal information with third party advertising partners, you may follow the instructions below.

Disclosures to Protect Us or Others. We may access, preserve, and disclose your personal information, other account information, and content if we believe doing so is required or appropriate to: comply with law enforcement or national security requests and legal process, such as a court order or subpoena; respond to your requests; protect your, our or others’ rights, property, or safety; to enforce our policies or contracts; to collect amounts owed to us; when we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to prevent physical harm or financial loss or in connection with an investigation or prosecution of suspected or actual illegal activity; or if we, in good faith, believe that disclosure is otherwise necessary or advisable. In addition, from time to time, server logs and other records may be reviewed for security purposes to detect unauthorized activity, illegal activity or fraud on the Site or Website Services. In such cases, personal information may be shared with law enforcement bodies in order that they may identify users in connection with their investigation of the unauthorized activities.

Share or Transfer Personal Information if Mobilewalla is involved in a merger, acquisition, financing due diligence, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, as part of such transaction. You will be notified via email or a notice on the Site of any change in ownership or uses of this information, if applicable.

Share Personal Information in any other circumstances where Mobilewalla receives your consent.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text:
Cookies, Social Media, Analytics & Advertising
We, as well as third parties that provide content, advertising, or other functionality on our Site and Website Services, may use cookies, pixel tags, local storage, and other technologies (“Technologies”) to automatically collect information through the Site and Website Services. We use Technologies that are essentially small data files placed on your computer, tablet, mobile phone, or other devices (referred to collectively as a "device") that allow us to record certain pieces of information whenever you visit or interact with our Site, Website Services, applications, messaging, and tools, and to recognize you across devices.

Cookies. Cookies are small text files placed in visitors’ computer browsers to store their preferences. Most browsers allow you to block and delete cookies. However, if you do that, the Site and Website Services may not work properly.

Pixel Tags/Web Beacons. A pixel tag (also known as a web beacon) is a piece of code embedded on the Site and Website Services that collects information about users’ engagement on that web page. The use of a pixel allows us to record, for example, that a user has visited a particular web page or clicked on a particular advertisement.

Social Media Integration: Our Site includes social media features. These features may collect your IP address, which page you are visiting on our site, and may set a cookie to enable the feature to function properly. These social media features are either hosted by a Third Party or hosted directly on our Site. Your interactions with these features are governed by the privacy policy of the company providing it.

Analytics. We may also use Google Analytics to collect information regarding visitor behavior and visitor demographics on our Site and Website Services. For more information, please visit www.google.com/policies/privacy/partners/. You can opt out of Google’s collection and processing of data generated by your use of the Services by going to http://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout.

Uses of such Technologies fall into the following general categories:

Operationally Necessary. We may use cookies, web beacons, or other similar technologies that are necessary to the operation of our Site, Website Services, applications, and tools. This includes Technologies that allow you access to our Site, Website Services, applications, and tools that are required to identify irregular site behavior, prevent fraudulent activity and improve security or that allow you to make use of our functions such as shopping-carts, saved search, or similar functions;
Performance Related. We may use cookies, web beacons, or other similar technologies to assess the performance of our Site, Website Services, applications, and tools, including as part of our analytic practices to help us understand how our visitors use our Site and Website Services, interact with our messaging, or view an item or link in order to improve our Site, Website Services, applications or tools;
Functionality Related. We may use cookies, web beacons, or other similar Technologies that allow us to offer you enhanced functionality when accessing or using our Site, Website Services, applications, or tools. This may include identifying you when you sign into our Site or Website Services or keeping track of your specified preferences, interests, or past items viewed so that we may enhance our Site and Website Services;
Advertising or Targeting Related. We may use first-party or third-party cookies and web beacons to deliver content, including ads relevant to your interests, on our Site and Website Services or on third party sites. This includes using Technologies to understand the usefulness to you of the advertisements and content that has been delivered to you, such as whether you have clicked on an advertisement.
If you would like to opt out of the Technologies we employ on our Site, Website Services, applications, or tools, you may do so by blocking, deleting, or disabling them as your browser or device permits. If you wish to delete cookies or limit the kinds of cookies that can be placed on your device you need to check out the settings in your browser, use the ‘Help’ tab or look for settings like ‘Options’ or ‘Privacy.’ From there, you may be able to delete cookies, block them or control when they can be placed.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: If you would like information about how to exercise any of these rights or if you have concerns about the way Mobilewalla processes your personal information, you are welcome to contact Mobilewalla at: privacy@mobilewalla.com.

Text: We collect personal information that identifies, relates to, describes, is reasonably capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with a particular consumer or household as described below.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: To exercise your privacy rights under the CCPA, please submit a verifiable consumer request to us by filling out this form, writing to us or emailing us. Please note that only you, or a person who you authorize to act on your behalf, may make a verifiable consumer request related to your personal information.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: We will not discriminate against you for exercising any of your CCPA rights.
Label: Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights

Text: You may also opt out of the sharing or “sale” of Personal Information by clicking the “Do Not Sell My Info” link  consistent with applicable law. While there are many positive aspects of the CCPA, California’s definition of “sale” includes transfers that ordinarily may not be thought of as a “sale” in the traditional sense of the word such as serving you an ad about our services after you leave our Site (see interest based ads above).
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: Cookies, Social Media, Analytics & Advertising\nWe, as well as third parties that provide content, advertising, or other functionality on our Site and Website Services, may use cookies, pixel tags, local storage, and other technologies (“Technologies”) to automatically collect information through the Site and Website Services.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Advertising or Targeting Related. We may use first-party or third-party cookies and web beacons to deliver content, including ads relevant to your interests, on our Site and Website Services or on third party sites. This includes using Technologies to understand the usefulness to you of the advertisements and content that has been delivered to you, such as whether you have clicked on an advertisement.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: If you would like to opt out of the Technologies we employ on our Site, Website Services, applications, or tools, you may do so by blocking, deleting, or disabling them as your browser or device permits.
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: If you wish to delete cookies or limit the kinds of cookies that can be placed on your device you need to check out the settings in your browser, use the ‘Help’ tab or look for settings like ‘Options’ or ‘Privacy.’ From there, you may be able to delete cookies, block them or control when they can be placed.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Your Choices\nConsent. You have the right to object to and change your preferences or opt out of certain uses and disclosures of your personal information. Where you have consented to our processing of your personal information, you may withdraw that consent at any time and prevent further processing by contacting us as described below subject to certain exceptions as described to your and/or allowed by law.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared

Text: Cookies and Interest-Based Advertising. As noted above, you may stop or restrict the placement of cookies on your computer or remove them from your browser by adjusting your web browser preferences.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: The online advertising industry also provides websites from which you may opt out of receiving targeted ads from our data partners and our other advertising partners that participate in self-regulatory programs. You can access these and learn about targeted advertising and consumer choice and privacy at www.youronlinechoices.eu/, www.aboutads.info/choices/, youradchoices.ca/choices/ and www.networkadvertising.org/managing/opt_out.asp.\n\nTo be clear, these cookie-based opt-outs must be performed on each device and browser that you wish to have opted-out. You must separately opt out in each browser on each device
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: 2. The Personal Information that You Provide to Mobilewalla Voluntarily\nWhen you contact Mobilewalla, by filling out a form on the Site, subscribing for email updates, requesting a trial of our services, participating in a survey or contacting our customer support team or when Mobilewalla contacts you regarding any of the above, we may receive and process any personal information that you provide such as your name and job title, your company’s name and type, phone number, country, and email address.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Mobilewalla may use the information you provide via the Site for its business’ purposes, such as responding to your inquiries or support requests, for marketing, recruiting and hiring, and to contact you in the course of providing you with any of the Website Services and/or the Mobilewalla newsletter or blog.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: 3. The Personal Information that Mobilewalla Collects Automatically\nWe may collect certain information automatically through our Site and Website Services, such as cookie identifiers, mobile carrier, mobile advertising identifiers, MAC address, IMEI, unique identifiers, browser type and language, hardware type, operating system, IP address, location, Internet service provider, and other actions taken through the use of the Website Services such as preferences. Mobilewalla may also collect information about your activity on the Site and Website Services (e.g., the duration of sessions, pages or content viewed, pages visited before and after using the Site or Website Services, and the date and time visited).
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Information We Process on Behalf of Our Business Customers. Our business customers may choose to use our Business Services to process certain data of their own, which may contain personal information. The data that we process through our Business Services is processed by us on behalf of our customer, and our privacy practices will be governed by the contracts that we have in place with our customers and the Business Services Privacy Policy, not this Policy.

Text: Research and Development. We may use personal information to create non-identifiable information that we may use alone or in the aggregate with information obtained from other sources, in order to help us to optimally deliver our Site and Website Services or develop new products. We may perform research via surveys and engage third party service providers to conduct such surveys on our behalf. All survey responses are voluntary, and the information collected will be used for research and reporting purposes to help us better serve individuals by learning more about their needs and the quality of the products and services we provide. The survey responses may be utilized to determine the effectiveness of our Site and Website Services, various types of communications, advertising campaigns, and/or promotional activities.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Other Uses. Mobilewalla will use information you provide to enforce Mobilewalla’s terms, policies and legal agreements, to comply with court orders and warrants, and assist law enforcement agencies, to collect debts, to detect and prevent malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity, to prevent and prosecute any misappropriation, infringements, identity thefts and any other misuse of the Website Services, and to take any action in any legal dispute and proceeding.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: De-identified and Aggregated Information Use. We may use personal information and other information about you to create de-identified and aggregated information, such as de-identified demographic information, de-identified location information, information about the computer or device from which you access our Site and Website Services, or other analyses we create. De-identified and aggregated information is used for a variety of functions, including the measurement of visitors’ interest in and use of various portions or features of the Site and Website Services. De-identified or aggregated information is not personal information, and we may use such information in a number of ways, including research, internal analysis, analytics, and any other legally permissible purposes
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: We may share this information within Mobilewalla and with third parties for our or their purposes in a de-identified or aggregated form that is designed to prevent anyone from identifying you

Text: 6. Sharing Personal Information with Others\nVendors and Service Providers. We may share any information we receive with vendors and service providers. The types of service providers (processors) to whom we entrust personal information include service providers for: IT and related services; the provision of information and services you have requested; payment processing; customer service activities; and the provision of the Site and Website Services.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: Marketing – Interest-Based Advertising and Third Party Marketing. Through our Site and Website Services, we may allow third party advertising partners to set tracking tools and Technologies to collect information regarding your activities and your device (e.g., your IP address, mobile identifiers, page(s) visited, location, time of day). We may also combine and share such information and other information (such as demographic information and past purchase history) with third party advertising partners. These advertising partners may use this information (and similar information collected from other websites) for purposes of delivering targeted advertisements to you when you visit third party websites within their networks.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: We may allow access to other data collected by the Site and Website Services to share information that may be useful, relevant, valuable or otherwise of interest to you.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: Disclosures to Protect Us or Others. We may access, preserve, and disclose your personal information, other account information, and content if we believe doing so is required or appropriate to: comply with law enforcement or national security requests and legal process, such as a court order or subpoena; respond to your requests; protect your, our or others’ rights, property, or safety; to enforce our policies or contracts; to collect amounts owed to us; when we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to prevent physical harm or financial loss or in connection with an investigation or prosecution of suspected or actual illegal activity; or if we, in good faith, believe that disclosure is otherwise necessary or advisable.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: In such cases, personal information may be shared with law enforcement bodies in order that they may identify users in connection with their investigation of the unauthorized activities.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: 7. Cookies, Social Media, Analytics & Advertising\nWe, as well as third parties that provide content, advertising, or other functionality on our Site and Website Services, may use cookies, pixel tags, local storage, and other technologies (“Technologies”) to automatically collect information through the Site and Website Services. We use Technologies that are essentially small data files placed on your computer, tablet, mobile phone, or other devices (referred to collectively as a "device") that allow us to record certain pieces of information whenever you visit or interact with our Site, Website Services, applications, messaging, and tools, and to recognize you across devices.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Cookies are small text files placed in visitors’ computer browsers to store their preferences

Text: 9. Human Resources Data\nMobilewalla collects personal information from current, prospective, and former employees, their contact points in case of a medical emergency, and beneficiaries under any insurance policy (“Human Resources Data”). The Human Resources Data we collect may include title, name, address, phone number, email address, date of birth, passport number, driver’s license number, Social Security number or other government-issued identification number, financial information related to credit checks, bank details for payroll, information that may be recorded on a CV or application form, language abilities, contact information of third parties in case of an emergency and beneficiaries under any insurance policy. We may also collect sensitive Human Resources Data such as details of health and disability, including mental health, medical leave, and maternity leave; information about national origin or immigration status; and optional demographic information such as race, which helps us achieve our diversity goals.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: 14. Information Security\nMobilewalla is committed to safeguarding the confidentiality of your personal information. Mobilewalla and its hosting services make reasonable efforts to secure your personal information, to minimize the risks of theft, damage, loss of information, or unauthorized access or use of information. However, Mobilewalla cannot guarantee that the Site or Website Services will be immune from any wrongdoings, malfunctions, unlawful interceptions or access, or other kinds of abuse and misuse.
Label: Others

Text: 15. Changes to this Policy\nThis Policy may change from time to time. If there are any material changes to this Policy, Mobilewalla will notify you through the Site or Website Services, by email or as otherwise required by applicable law. You understand and agree that you will be deemed to have accepted the updated Policy if you use the Site and Website Services after the updated Policy is posted to this website. If at any point you do not agree to any portion of the Policy then in effect, you must immediately stop using the Site and Website Services.
